text: Is there any documentation available for the various “dnd” tags (dnd_area, dnd_section, dnd_module)?

Currently not yet. We know everyone is eager to get their hands on it. We want to make sure the information we provide is complete, clear, and accurate before making it available.

If you would like to be able to try all of the functionality of the boilerplate that was announced at the Community Developer Meetup last week - please sign up here for the beta:
<https://forms.gle/8GcSiqNULuoa29QM8>

The documentation information should be shared out to those who sign up
Thanks for the details.  I did fill out that form, but I’m using a developer sandbox that was created some time ago. Do I need to request a new one to use the boilerplate templates?
(also I don’t remember exactly which portal I put in the form. It may have been our main portal and not a developer sandbox)

I believe it was mentioned at the dev event that priority will be given to sandbox portals, and normal portals will not get the functionality at first. I would resubmit the form with your developer sandbox portal. You should not need to request a new portal to use the boilerplate templates.
ok cool and then I’ll just have to wait to be notified that the features are enabled?
is this just for website pages or also landing pages?
A little update here...we just published a getting started guide for the drag-and-drop HubL: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/tutorials/drag-and-drop-areas>
let us know if you have feedback
Also answering your question earlier the dnd tags will be usable on both website and landing page templates.
